imgDesc.text: A mural depicting Herblord and Fujin.

customize.text: Thousands of years ago, long before the Archon War, there was another goddess in Chenyu Vale, who Herblord and her friend, Fujin, served. The true form of the Adeptus Herblord was a white snake with yellow eyes, but for healing sick mortals and creating medicines, she preferred the human form: a woman with fair skin and golden eyes. Together with Fujin, she became friends with the azure Suanni, who had lived in the vale long before people arrived there.

One day, Herblord planted an Adeptal Tree. Then the mechanism that powered the tree was destroyed and the tree dried up, but Herblord said that as long as the vivid butterflies did not fly away, the tree could be revived. Previously, the Adeptus decorated the gates leading to this tree with colorful butterflies. During the Archon War, she split some Adeptal energy off and injected it into these butterflies, greatly increasing their lifespan. Then, even if something would happen to the snake Adeptus, the mortals of Chenyu Vale might be able to follow the butterflies' guidance and find the formulae Herblord left behind.

<color=#ffffffd9>"As the vivid butterflies converge in the jar, the adeptal energy surges anew, akin to new life restored to a withered tree..."</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"...Born in winter, thriving and withering through time. But I yearn for spring when beauty is regained..."</color>

customize.name: Chenyu Vale
customize.desc:
The gentle breezes carry the fragrance of tea all across the mountains of Liyue, filling the air with the savory scent once more.

"Tea grows upon the rocks, where jade springs endlessly flow." The faint perfume and ancient song of jade drift together along the rivers past Qiaoying Village to the bustling port of Yilong Wharf. Just what adventures and fortune await, concealed among the fog-robed peaks of the south...?

customize.desc: Adepti are a group of immortal illuminated beasts of Liyue, who have protected people for millennia.

customize.text:
When the Heavenly Principles declared a war for the divine throne and rule of Teyvat, the Master of Herblord and Fujin fought against Rex Lapis. According to Fujin, her lord went mad seeking the position of a god who may rule this world, or she was simply trying to survive, because she understood that she could not defeat Morax. In a desperate attempt to reverse fate, she caused the Bishui River to overflow its banks, destroying everything downstream. Herblord and Fujin could not allow people to die, so they went against their goddess. According to legend, Herblord delayed the goddess with a battle, and Fujin threw the Votive Rainjade into the water, which stopped the river from flooding. Lingyuan summoned her familiars, the Xuanwen beasts, to help her friends and drive the people into the caves. During the war, Herblord spent a lot of her energy, and later left Chenyu Vale and found her home in Liyue Harbor.

customize.name: Xuanwen Beast
customize.desc:
Xuanwen Beasts, named for the dark patterns on their bodies, are fierce creatures that inhabit the mountains of Chenyu Vale.
In the region's folklore, these beasts were the servants of an adeptus in ancient times, tasked with vanquishing evil and protecting the region. However, they devolved into brutal creatures after said adeptus passed away. These legends cannot be verified, and no one knows the true identity of this adeptus. This much is for sure, however — one should stay away from these aggressive creatures for one's safety.
For over a thousand years, these beasts have lost a tremendous amount of territory that once belonged to them to relentless human encroachment. These days, they can only occasionally be spotted in the remote mountains of Chenyu Vale...

customize.text:
After the Archon War, when Liyue was overcome by illness and pestilence, one doctor made a pledge to rid the world of pain and suffering. He went to Chenyu Vale in search of Herblord, but in her abode he found only a white snake with all its powers spent. The snake invited the doctor to enter into an agreement connecting their lives: in exchange for the doctor’s life force, the snake would teach him the secret art of healing. The doctor accepted the conditions and was able to save many lives, but one day his hour of farewell came. He passed on the agreement with the snake to his best disciple, and they then passed it onto their disciple. The last person with whom the snake Changsheng entered into an agreement is the doctor and owner of the Bubu Pharmacy, Baizhu, who intends to find a cure for death.
Judging by the fact that Herblord, who lost the ability to take on human form, was a snake with yellow eyes, could heal people and found her home in Liyue Harbor, it can be assumed that Changsheng may be Herblord herself.
